channel.title: Question about Counting Coup mechanism
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Question about Counting Coup mechanism" - 2 items for fighting - bug or feature?

item.title: Re: Question about Counting Coup mechanism
Re: Question about Counting Coup mechanism
item.content:encoded:
NOTES FROM THE DESK OF THE 11DBHK: So, I've been looking at Villages recently, and now that Terri 3 (yay Terri) is in the mix, the main reason to be a Leader - the auto Monster Drop - is kinda moot. Now, if you are the only one that has Terri 3, you just kick the tires of a kaiju, and bam, free shiny. That's cool and all, but it makes being a Leader kinda 'meh'. So, starting tomorrow, the following Leader Bonus is active:
"If you are the Leader of a Village at Dayroll, during the next day, while you are still the Leader of that Village, you get +30 Stamina, +10% Ryo in Regular Missions, your Kaiju Damage is Doubled, and your Collection Actions and Patrol Actions are Tripled."

item.title: Re: Question about Counting Coup mechanism
item.content:encoded: Does this mean that a kage can use terri 3 to get a 2nd item drop as he is getting one anyway? Or does it not work for kages?

item.title: Re: Question about Counting Coup mechanism
item.content:encoded: I don't know what a tropth is, but it you mean drop, then yes, you can win 2 drops during a kaiju battle if you use Terri 3.

item.title: Re: Question about Counting Coup mechanism
item.content:encoded: If it had been set up that way, it would encourage powerful season 3 players with Terri 3 to only hit a kaiju once or twice, something McMasters does not want.
